intro: Hieracium praevaricans, commonly known as the variable hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow to orange composite flowers, which consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has a rosette of basal leaves that are often hairy and lobed. Hieracium praevaricans is known for its variability in leaf shape and flower color, making it a challenging species to identify.
